title: Gravity, Greenery, and Going Sideways: How I Got This Gig
content:
Okay, so maybe taking a shortcut through the Verdantian Import Zone during a Third Tuesday gravity reversal wasn't my brightest idea pre-coffee. One minute, I'm dodging floating crates of Sunpetal Blooms – seriously, those things pack a psychic wallop even when they *aren't* defying gravity – the next... bam. Reality decided to use my brain as a blender. Colors tasted like static, I could hear the houseplants gossiping three blocks away about Mrs. Henderson's terrible taste in curtains, and gravity was less 'down' and more 'suggested, maybe sideways, with a hint of polka?'

Woke up in Ephergent HQ medbay. Head pounding like a Cogsworthian trip-hammer quartet tuning up for a weekend reversal gig. Everything smelled faintly of ozone and... espresso? That's when I met A1. Or rather, A1 met me, extending a metallic arm with a steaming cup. 'Analysis suggests caffeine intake may stabilize perceptual flux,' it buzzed, or whatever sound a quantum-computing espresso machine makes. 'Also, you appear to have undergone spontaneous multi-dimensional sensory integration.'

Turns out, accidentally dimension-hopping via psychoactive flora during a predictable-yet-always-surprising gravity flip gives you... perspective. Lots of it. All at once. A1 here calls it 'multi-dimensional perception.' I call it needing stronger coffee and maybe some reality anchors for my eyeballs. A1 assures me the predictive foam art on my espresso – currently depicting a screaming question mark morphing into a slightly less stressed question mark – says I'll get used to it. Said robot also filtered out the worst of the noise – turns out five dimensions yelling at you simultaneously is *loud*. Especially the Cogsworthians arguing about temporal etiquette and the Nocturne contingent composing spontaneous dirges about the quality of the medbay lighting.

Anyway, long story short, the brass here at The Ephergent figured anyone who could accidentally perceive the houseplant shadow government's internal memo about optimizing fertilizer distribution was probably qualified to report on the multiverse. Said my 'unique viewpoint' was an asset. Apparently, 'Wait, did that cyber-dino banker just phase through the wall to avoid a late fee?' counts as investigative journalism now. Fine by me. Someone's gotta report on this beautiful, baffling, bonkers reality soup, might as well be the person who tripped face-first into it. Now, about that CLX advance... gotta pay the cyber-dino tolls somehow, right? And maybe invest in some lead-lined sunglasses. Plus, there's something about this HQ... sometimes feels like the building itself is listening. Or maybe that's just the weird espresso A1 keeps giving me.
